LayoutNode.Content: We encourage submissions of high quality papers on all topics in the general areas of databases, information retrieval, and knowledge management. Papers should contain previously unpublished work and not be under submission to other conferences or journals.
LayoutNode.SRC: We encourage submissions of high quality papers on all topics in the general areas of databases, information retrieval, and knowledge management. Papers should contain previously unpublished work and not be under submission to other conferences or journals.

LayoutNode.Content: Details on how to submit to CIKM 2011 are available on the submissions page.
LayoutNode.SRC: Details on how to submit to CIKM 2011 are available on the submissions page.

LayoutNode.Content: Papers that bridge across these areas are of special interest and will be considered for a "Best Interdisciplinary Paper" award. Topics of interest in the three areas include, but are not limited to:
LayoutNode.SRC: Papers that bridge across these areas are of special interest and will be considered for a "Best Interdisciplinary Paper" award. Topics of interest in the three areas include, but are not limited to:

LayoutNode.Content: Data quality, provenance, adaptability and reusability
Data exchange, integration, evolution and migration
Database languages and models (e.g., fuzzy data, probabilistic databases, meta-data management)
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Database languages and models (e.g., fuzzy data, probabilistic databases, meta-data management)

LayoutNode.Content: Domain-specific databases (multi-media, scientific, spatial, temporal, text)
Dynamic aspects of databases (updates, views, real-time data, sensor data, active databases, data streams)
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Dynamic aspects of databases (updates, views, real-time data, sensor data, active databases, data streams)

LayoutNode.Content: Mobile, parallel and distributed data management (including cloud computing)
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Mobile, parallel and distributed data management (including cloud computing)

LayoutNode.Content: Semi-structured data processing, XML filtering and routing
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Semi-structured data processing, XML filtering and routing

LayoutNode.Content: String databases, blogs and social search
Workflow, Web services and Web Service Composition
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Workflow, Web services and Web Service Composition

LayoutNode.Content: Aggregated search, Enterprise search, Desktop search
Cross-language retrieval, Multilingual retrieval, Machine translation for IR
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Cross-language retrieval, Multilingual retrieval, Machine translation for IR

LayoutNode.Content: Distributed IR, Peer to peer IR
Domain-specific IR: genomic, legal, mobile, patents, ...
Evaluation, Test collections, Crowdsourcing for IR evaluation
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Evaluation, Test collections, Crowdsourcing for IR evaluation

LayoutNode.Content: Foundations of IR: Theory, Formal models
HCIR, User Interfaces, Interactive IR, User models, User studies
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>HCIR, User Interfaces, Interactive IR, User models, User studies

LayoutNode.Content: Language technologies for IR (NLP, IE, Summarization, QA, ...)
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Language technologies for IR (NLP, IE, Summarization, QA, ...)

LayoutNode.Content: Multimedia IR: audio, speech, image, video, and cross-media
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Multimedia IR: audio, speech, image, video, and cross-media

LayoutNode.Content: Web IR and Social media search
Other topics related to IR (Adverserial IR, Advertising, Privacy, Text Mining, etc.)
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Other topics related to IR (Adverserial IR, Advertising, Privacy, Text Mining, etc.)

LayoutNode.Content: Knowledge and privacy (e.g., privacy-preserving data publishing and mining)
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Knowledge and privacy (e.g., privacy-preserving data publishing and mining)

LayoutNode.Content: Mining the usage, consumption and production of resources
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Mining the usage, consumption and production of resources

LayoutNode.Content: Temporal, Spatial and Ubiquitous Data Mining

Industry authors are invited to submit papers describing solutions in the domains addressed by this conference, focusing on the technical aspects of their work. The submission procedure for industrial papers is the same as for research papers.
LayoutNode.SRC: Industry authors are invited to submit papers describing solutions in the domains addressed by this conference, focusing on the technical aspects of their work. The submission procedure for industrial papers is the same as for research papers.

LayoutNode.Content: ACM CIKM review is double-blind. Therefore, please anonymise your submission. Non-anonymous submissions will be rejected. If your CIKM 2011 submission is an extension of a previously-published workshop paper the contributions beyond that workshop paper should be discussed in the related work section, referencing the workshop paper as an anonymous citation.
LayoutNode.SRC: ACM CIKM review is double-blind. Therefore, please anonymise your submission. Non-anonymous submissions will be rejected. If your CIKM 2011 submission is an extension of a previously-published workshop paper the contributions beyond that workshop paper should be discussed in the related work section, referencing the workshop paper as an anonymous citation.

LayoutNode.Content: All accepted papers will be published in the ACM CIKM proceedings, which will be distributed in CD format at the conference. All papers will be indexed in the ACM digital library.
LayoutNode.SRC: All accepted papers will be published in the ACM CIKM proceedings, which will be distributed in CD format at the conference. All papers will be indexed in the ACM digital library.

LayoutNode.Content: Conference co-Chairs: Iadh Ounis (University of Glasgow) and Ian Ruthven (University of Strathclyde)
